intro: Mespilodaphne ligulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daphne, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, evergreen leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Mespilodaphne ligulata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
